page.title: 15Stone, Post, and Cairns
page.content: At 952 feet above sea-level on { {Longstone Hill}is a mysterious {standing stone}near the path down to the {Great Road. { }There are two triangulation stations in the area, one near{Hurley Beacon} and the other{on Beacon Hill}obove{ {Staple.}Often people use these places as advantage points for photography. On the{Quantock Ridge}near where the{ {Great Road}crosses stands a wooden post about 5feet high. This is{ {Bicknoller Post}and is said to mark the change over place for horses after pulling coaches up the steep tracks. There are several{Cairns}and{ {Tumuli}dotted along the tracks. The largest of these is{Hurley Fire {Beacon,}this was recently rekindled to celebrate the{Queens Silver Jubilee and then the{Prince of Wales Wedding.
